author: carlhenryglobal
title: Cardano Community Hubs DAO &cDDK
description: Hello Dear Reader! Cardano doesn't offer full guidance & framework tools for the creation & operation of DAOs on Cardano. Hubs don't realise the amazing DAO opportunity to self-fund a real business.

author: konmaorg
title: KonmaDAO - A DAO of DAOs
description: While Cardano provides a great space for hosting DAOs, community members and new entrants are unaware of the Cardano ecosystem, dev support, tools & resources etc.

author: ninhtran
title: Plural Voting and Identity for DAOs
description: DAOs in & out of Cardano don't have access to more advanced voting systems with Sybil resistance and resort to 1-coin-1-vote that doesn't always resolve in optimal decisions, funding, & collaboration.

author: harry.hellyer
title: SPO Learning Support Community DAO
description: Cardano needs SPOs to provide a resilient, high-availability network to attract DAO creators. SPOs are mission critical - their ability to flourish is equally critical. But they have little support.

author: danadak
title: Collab Platform for DAO Operations
description: We are now connected in groups far larger than our ability to think and coordinate with the traditional in-person means for of collaboration.

author: rhysstoic
title: DAO Turn Key Deployment
description: Lots of projects are currently building on Cardano but have to fund their own UI development, service & tool integration and more

author: defi.babylon
title: JUS - More DIDs = More DAOs
description: For DAO's to scale and have a global impact, decentralized ID solutions need mainstream adoption.

author: lpanchot
title: Clarity DAO Infrastructure
description: There is not an existing solution on Cardano that enables non technical DAO creation, DAO proposal/treasury management, and DAO governance participation.

author: jschreiner22
title: Clarity DAO Incubator
description: Creating and managing a DAO requires a wide variety of expertise ranging from distributed team management, tokenomics design, marketing, and more. This expertise not easily accessible to new DAOs.

author: jo8n
title: DAO DAO! (sing song, like: tä-ˈdä!)
description: Ensure you say what is wrong. --> DAO: 1) Decentralized 2) Autonomous 3) Organization has no TRUE definition: <3...Has anyone used community created DAO tools to make a DAO of One person on Cardano?

author: littlefish.foundation
title: littlefish - Ikigai in Community
description: Participants of digital communities lack visibility on each other. Individuals' interests, skills, and wants are not visible to others. This slows down collaboration in decentralized work.

author: altimario
title: e-Learning DAO, Builds the platform
description: Ed-Tech giants (like Coursera) monopolised the e-Learning market, pay poorly instructors and pollute the ecosystem with cheap materials with little pedagogical quality. No space for fair competition.

author: agustin
title: Education on DAOs
description: To build a descentralized solutions for the Cardano ecosystem are needed builders that understand the complexity of designing and running a DAO, today that knowledge is not widely available.

author: cryptoloops
title: CNFT Alliance DAO & Launchpad
description: Currently, there are multiple segmented DAOs within the Cardano ecosystem that cover specific projects, but there isn't a DAO or launchpad that covers a sector of the ecosystem.

author: diegotorres
title: Web3 Onboarding DAO
description: The crypto industry onboarding can be overwhelming for most people. Access to grants is a great way to learn and experiment in this field. Most spanish speaker people don't know how to approach this

author: geekship
title: Scalable Open Innovation Ledger
description: People spend lots of time arguing over everything on the internet, but important discussions get drowned in meaningless chatter or are siloed behind patents and paywals in academia / corporations.

author: samchristensen
title: Munchy Go Delivery Food dApp DAO
description: Stakeholders on traditional business models, don't have any impact on management in the ecosystems they live in. Building DAO food delivery app! We want to streamline decentralize management.

author: lift
title: SharpDAO - DAO Tooling for Cardano
description: Currently the Cardano community has a lack of tools that help people create and manage DAOs.

author: thiago.ouros
title: OpenSource for Sustainable DAOs
description: Some DAOs can have a hard time to become sustainable and to improve this we need open source tools that can generate extra revenue.

author: lutvirosyady
title: Ads Platform SSP & DSP with Cardano
description:
There is a few advertising platform using Blockchain in Globe especially in Indonesia. The main issue
digital advertising is only working on the online things (Web and App) and the ROI Tracking.

author: profd2004
title: Blockchain Surveys for DAOs & More
description: There's no user-friendly, on-chain mechanism for DAOs, researchers, marketing teams, etc. to ask their communities questions, conduct voting, and help make group decisions.

author: fanna
title: BORA: Empower Tomorrow’s Leaders
description: Thousands of students are excluded from education because they cannot access student loans (funding) due to a lack of a credit record and/or lack of access to funding.

author: littlefish.foundation
title: littlefish - Tools of DAO Work
description: Staying on top of developments in decentralized technology like wallets, smart contracts, DAO platforms, and other enabling technologies like digital work tools is difficult.

author: wada
title: Web3 Education DAO by Wada
description: Without accessible DAO tools on Cardano, Wada’s education, outreach and onboarding success in Africa has been a manual process. Lack of scalable organizing tools, limits quality, growth and inclusion

author: natdwamena
title: Ubuntu Crypto Use Map DAO
description: Africa is a target for most innovative businesses that are integrating crypto use. How do we easily locate businesses adopting crypto use in Africa?

author: pace
title: Funding Categories Analysis
description: The challenge setting process needed thorough analysis to make suggestions on how to improve funding categorisation within Catalyst

author: algaetoken
title: Develop a Product and Services DAO
description: There are currently no DAO's that provide services and physical products on the Cardano Blockchain

author: adaminnow
title: ADAO Open Source Development
description: Fund ADAO open source! ADAO's Community of over 3,000 members and 20 + Core contributors have been steadily contributing to and incentivizing contributions to open source development on Cardano.

author: b4ggreg
title: Catalyst GPS and Blockchain4Good
description: Blockchain4Good is a growing collective of projects with their own engaged and motivated communities. We need support in effective collaboration management to organize community intentions and actions

author: governance.services.guild
title: Governance Services Guild tools
description: Cardano lacks training in the implementation of distributed collaboration tools for governance that are open source, inclusive and adaptable to a variety of community intentions and actions.

author: bobkvan
title: NFT Fractionalization System
description: Being able to directly own DAO treasury NFT assets requires a system that enables members to participate in a fair and representative distribution mechanism that currently doesn't exist.

author: tosidrop
title: TosiDrop DAO Governance Platform
description: DAOs rely on a governance and voting mechanism to allow community members to contribute to the direction of a protocol. TosiDrop is implementing a seamless on-chain voting mechanism.

author: dali720
title: Inukshuk Healthdata Wallet
description:
Within 3 year, 75% of clinical trials will be patient-centric, decentralized clinical trials. 
This requiress an integrated platform. Personal DataWallets on Cardano are the basis of this solution..

author: darenft
title: DAO for multi-asset NFT
description:
Most of the NFTs on the market are single-asset NFTs (each NFT represents only one digital asset)
Therefore, the NFT will become worthless when the server containing the data of that asset crashes

author: dov
title: dLiber8
description:
DAOs make decisions.
Good decisions require good discussions.
Threaded message platforms are slow and labor intensive.
Live discussions are often more engaging but subject to disorder and domination.

author: gabrielaxel
title: Gov3 - DAO Delegation Dashboard
description: Efficiency in DAO operations is achieved by delegating decision-making power to dedicated working groups. Current tools do not provide sufficient delegation monitoring & management capabilities.

author: sergio.sp
title: Almagua Social DAO Project
description: In Colombia, a platform of initiatives is needed that encourages projects for the communities

author: thiago.ouros
title: Brazilian Community DAO
description: The Brazilian community needs a DAO to act independently on day-to-day pain points, as well as get a first glimpse of how to govern and engage as a DAO.

author: baxter30
title: ADAO: Comprehensive DAO's Course
description: There’s a lack of educational DAO content within the Cardano ecosystem.

author: trewil
title: EnDAOment : Endowment Framework
description: DAOs lack tooling and legal clarity for managing their treasury, specifically endowment funds generating staking yield.

author: catalystswarm
title: Catalyst Swarm DAO Tools
description: The growing Cardano & Catalyst Ecosystems needs innovative & effective ways to engage, motivate and reward community contributions by participating in DAO systems

author: anetabtc
title: anetaBTC, DAO Infrastructure
description: We must have a protocol that unlocks the value of Bitcoin on Cardano to fully optimize Cardano DeFi potential. We must also have open-sourced DAO tools to grow our ecosystem.

author: littlefish.foundation
title: littlefish - Redefining Earning
description: Earning solutions today limit individuals, take away their freedom in the work space, and chain them to jobs that prevent personal growth and fulfillment in the name of financial safety.

author: astroboysoup
title: CardanoPress: Governance Plugin
description: Technical knowledge is required to create a platform where users can vote on-chain. CardanoPress Governance plugin makes this process easy by integrating web2 features with on-chain voting.

author: lpanchot
title: DLT360/CC: Building Compliant DAOs
description: For projects that want to operate as DAOs there is no easy way to understand the legal & implementation risks and paths forward to operating as a compliant DAO.

author: lpanchot
title: Cardano DAO Dashboard
description: There is no easy way for users to understand the state of Cardano DAOs and how decentralized and autonomous an organization is.

author: latamcardano
title: LATAM TownHall
description:
LATAM is very underrepresented in the Decentralization space, but has amazing opportunities to catch up, specially with CARDANO
Sharing, awareness on Cardano and places to meet and collaborate are key

author: seedstars
title: Research on Mentorship Tokenization
description: Startup mentorship communities don't currently have a proven use case for DAOs. There are no best practices or frameworks for how these communities can best be moved from a centralized model to a DAO.

author: adaraimova
title: ADAwell: Wellbeing DAO
description: Wellbeing portals are not reliable & monetize user attention via ads, sponsorships. Today’s health care system focuses on only disease and doesn’t seek a holistic approach or a health optimization.

author: ololuo1
title: Voteaire Escrow Smart Contract
description: DAOs based on Cardano lack easy-to-use tools for automatically distributing funds based on a governance vote.

author: seedstars
title: Mentorship Digital Identity DAO
description: There are no best practices or frameworks for how mentorship of blockchain startups and projects can best be moved from a centralized model to a DAO.

author: gilvania
title: Cardano/DAO for Brazilian Companies
description: The Brazilian software engineering companies need to be aware of the Cardano Blockchain and DAOs.

author: legrand
title: CNGO - DAOs & NGOs working together
description: Current methods used to ensure transparency of donor-NGO relationships are time consuming & easily infringed leading to mismanagement of funds & embezzlement without any stakeholder accountability.

author: dao.coders
title: DAO-NET: ZKP Sybil Defense Service
description: How to create a one-member one-vote style DAO that is resistant to Sybil attacks, requires zero knowledge and is completely decentralized?

author: dao.coders
title: DAO-NET: Participate to Earn
description: How can DAOs incentivize participation without draining their treasury?

author: jpg.store
title: NFT powered Turnkey DAOs
description: Cardano at the time of writing this proposal has 56000+ policy IDs that represent collections of different utility, collectability and art with barely any collection having a working on-chain DAO.

author: jpg.store
title: JPG DAO: User-First NFT Ecosystem
description: The NFT Ecosystems across chains have been growing rapidly, yet marketplaces are mostly run in a centralized fashion without user input or control.

author: yojo
title: Smarthubs=more impact/adoption
description: It’s not clear how to use a DAO as the model and collaborative structure for ‘smart’ business development hubs interacting and operating in various countries, sharing data, tools, roles, resources

author: ronald.m.valencia
title: DEX using Protocol Owned Liquidity!
description:
2 problems in DEFI
1) Mercenary liquidity

Entities provide liquidity, mine tokens, dump tokens and finally pull the liquidity from the protocol.

2) Blatant token printing from projects.

author: muesliswap
title: Secure off-chain community voting
description: Voting protocols with astonishing security properties have long been a topic in cryptography. For Cardano off-chain voting systems no implementations of such perfectly suited systems are available.

author: sofi.heessen
title: Cardano Commoner: SofiH
description: The ecosystem has many projects that require interconnectivity but without cross project collaboration this difficult to achieve

author: benjaminhartin
title: 'What The DAO?' Twitter Space
description: There is no DAO-specific meeting place on Social Media aimed at interviewing significant people in the world of DAOs, geared towards adopting Cardano as the premier “DAO-Space” across all blockchains.

author: daedelan
title: Open-Source DAO Framework
description: Sustainable DAOs don’t exist, but they should. DAOs are susceptible to eventual centralization and centralized institutions usually become corrupted.

author: tevosaks
title: Innovation Fund Research - Roles
description: We lack an overview of interactions between the Catalyst community roles in different funding stages.

author: cnftguild
title: NFT Guild Operations
description:
The Cardano NFT community is working in silos on similar initiatives for tools and standards.
It needs an open space to network, connect ideas and projects and set standards collectively.

author: quasar
title: CAT_ID Catalyst SSI
description: Decentralized and Distributed Organizations may have many members or participants that move in and out of roles and other organizations.

author: nebiyus
title: Gig workers DAO
description: Gig work does not come with pensions, sick pay, holiday entitlement or parental leave.

author: cenkner
title: paoDAO School of Blockchain
description: Few solid use cases exist for DAOs and DIDs; education focuses on evaluation and less on learning; blockchain-related curriculum is hard to find and update; few are motivated to participate in upkeep.

author: adivenkat
title: Konma x SardaM DAO
description: There exists no solution on the Cardano ecosystem, region specific to South-Asia, encouraging the spread of awareness regarding the Cardano blockchain and its implementation of the Haskell language.

author: tarun
title: PropX DAO :- Property Exchange DAO
description: Real Estate is an illiquid asset, which means that trading is a lengthy and bureaucratic process; ownership does not swap hands quickly. Real Estate is reserved to a high ticket sector of the society.

author: rogervs
title: DAO Infrastructure Framework (DIF)
description: DAO's are dependent on centralised services from a multitude of closed source providers. Not only does this make them vulnerable to censorship, they're too complicated to use for ordinary people.
